newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU still looking at BBL shareholder pact.
newsitem.headline: EU still looking at BBL shareholder pact.

text.p: The European Commission is still studying whether a shareholder pact for the control of Belgian Banque Bruxelles Lambert (BBL) breaks EU competition rules, a spokesman for Competiton Commissioner Karel Van Miert said on Thursday.
He told Reuters it was not sure yet when a decision would be reached and declined to indicate what could be decided.
Just 10 days ago, the Commission had received new documents about the case from BBL, he said.
In June 1996, the Commission wrote to the shareholders, warning that their 1995 agreement could breach EU anti-trust law.
The three are Belgian holding company Groupe Bruxelles Lambert, insurer Royale Belge and Belgian Credit Communal/Gemeentekrediet bank, which together control 37.5 percent of BBL shares.
BBL has been the focus of renewed takeover speculation since the start of the year, after shareholders of rival Generale Bank said they would like to see it merge with BBL.
Generale Bank chief executive officer Ferdinand Chaffart said earlier this week he was not against a link-up with BBL.
